Reviews.Title: Good value on 32 inch LCD
Reviews.Author: J. Foster
Reviews.Content: The Toshiba 32AV502U seems to be a good value for a 720p LCD.  It was easy to set up on the stand; the hook-up to my cable, TIVO unit, and playstation was easy; the initial set up for all the available channels was pretty easy and fast; and the picture is great.  The only negatives are that the remote control & remote control buttons are too small, the ability of the set to switch between various functions seems a little slow (in other words moving from one menu screen to the next), and the process of switching back and forth between inputs is especially slow and tedious.  Maybe as I learn more about the functions I can figure out a faster way to accomplish this but I haven't found anything in the manual yet or by playing with the various buttons.

Reviews.Title: Suits my needs perfectly - great image for the money
Reviews.Author: David Bauckham
Reviews.Content: I have had this product for about three weeks now, and so far I am very pleased with it.  The picture, which I receive from an indoor/outdoor antenna is extremely crisp.  I would recommend those of you out there pondering whether or not to get cable/satellite to consider simply installing a good antenna - that way there is no video compression, and you actually get a sharper image from the local networks.  I honestly cannot tell the difference between my TV's image as a 720p and my brother-law's 47" 1080p Sony.The TV menu is easy to see and use.  I keep my video settings on sports generally, as it is the brightest picture (some of the others, like "movie" are just too dark for me).  However, you can also adjust the picture in preference mode, and play around with brightness, sharpness, contrast, backlight, color, and tint.I also own a wii system, and even though it is not high definition like some other gaming systems, I have to say that the picture on this TV is excellent (especially with the wii component cables attached).The sound on the TV is also very full - I did not notice any tinniness coming from the speakers at all, and it seemed well balanced between base and treble. It will obviously not produce the same depth of sound as a full sound system, but it suits my needs perfectly.There is, as the other reviewer indicated a minor lag time when switching between inputs, but this really doesn't bother me.  One mildly annoying element however is that most of the inputs (HDMI, component cables (AKA color stream), PC inputs, S-Video, etc.) are on the back of the TV, which is a mild nuisance. The only exception to this is Video 2, which is on the side.  (This would probably be good for connecting a digital camcorder and the like).The only other thing that seems a little inconsistent is PC connectivity.  When I hook up my laptop (I use an RGB computer video cable and audio cable since my computer doesn't have a built in HDMI port) it is necessary for me to turn the laptop off, connect the cables and then reboot, or the image will not display on the TV.  Perhaps this is a standard thing for most TVs - I don't really know, having never owned an HDTV with PC inputs before.  Also, the TV seems to project the computer screen a little differently each time the computer is hooked up, and I sometimed have to do a little tweaking to get an image I'm happy with.  This may just require more trial-and-error on my part.  Since my primary purpose is to use the TV as a TV screen and DVD player and not a computer screen, this isn't a big deal to me.On the whole, I am extremely satisfied with this purchase.  It does its job well, displaying an excellent, non-pixelated image and it is even an energy star product, so it should save energy and money.  There are other good deals on the market, but I really think that this is one of the best.  It is hard to beat the price being offered by Amazon right now.I will update later if my opinion of this product changes or I have anything more to add.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful, seems like best bang for buck
Reviews.Author: Brian De Leon
Reviews.Content: I bought this LCD the weekend of Black Friday. I was hesitant, but i could not pass up on the price match I was getting. It comes in a big box, light sturdy.Initial set up was easy plug and play done. The stand is easy to place and comes with screws. Channel set up is easy,finds the channels fast. This has different mode sin which you can set, for an example; gaming mode, theater mode, sports mode, and normal. I use this especially for gaming with my PS3 and Oh my God it is BEAUTIFUL! picture is so crips and clear.the only problems I discovered isremote lags at times. Really oversize remote. Buttons sometimes lag to perform.A few times my speakers seem to crackle, pop.then come back to orignal sound, but i think it may because im still on regular cable. but otherwise ok.the lcd hd tv is very sexy, sleek looking I LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: great picture short life span.
Reviews.Author: Robert V. Johnson
Reviews.Content: this TV has the best display that I had seen when I was shopping for my first LCD TV. Thank God for the 200 dollar extended service plan because the TV did not last more then 6 mo. I paid over a thousand dollars with the extended service plan and they are now telling me that the parts are no longer available to fix my TV.... and all I get is a prorated refund of 500 dollars.  I will never buy any Toshiba product.

Reviews.Title: Good buy for the price
Reviews.Author: Rigoberto Anchondo
Reviews.Content: I bought this a month ago for the bedroom and am very pleased with the picture. I find the picture as good or better than the picture on my Sony Bravia which was much more expensive. The speaker quality is average (hence the 4 stars), but since I have mine hooked up with a surround system, it is a non issue for me.  If you plan to use the TV speakers and like to crank the sound up, you might be a little dissappointed as they are a bit tinny and don't have much power.  The speakers are good for everyday users.As far as overall product quality, I know that Sony is SUPPOSED to be the better brand, BUT I have had three other Toshiba products over the last 16 years, 2 TVs, and my laptop and they are all working great. Never had an issue. I have had three Sony products, a camcorder, the surround in my living room, and the Bravia over the last 7 years and I have had every single product break down on me to some degree or another.  Sony always comes at a premium price so it is my experience that Toshiba is undervalued.I will stick with Toshiba from now on.

Reviews.Title: Great value, very happy with this purchase
Reviews.Author: Lucky
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after returning a Sony 32M4000.The picture looks great and the price was considerably cheaper than the Sony. The Sony's picture looked washed out when viewed from an angle and it made people's faces look like the living dead.  I do not notice this with the Toshiba.  The picture looks wonderful.  I also like that the connections on the back are pointed in the downward direction (rather than toward the wall) so that your cables do not have to make a 90 degree bend.I'm using it in a bedroom so I didn't see a need for 1080P resolution.  Overall this TV seems like a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for price but note the VESA mounting holes
Reviews.Author: Ashmeed Hossain "Ash Hossain"
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv Dec 22, 2008 and mounted it on a bedroom wall.The problem is the Vesa mounting hole is 200 X 400. Most mounts come with 100x100, 100X200 or 200X200.I bought a Peerless Mount PA740 for $65.00 from Amazon then I had to buy an additional adapter plate for $79.00. So make sure you buy the correct mount for this tv. Other than that the picture is superb.It comes with the latest HDMI v1.3 connections.I used a MONOPRICE HDMI v1.3 cable and I am amazed at the quality of the picture this cable produced. I paid only $5.35 for this cable. I have always used Monster cables but this cable is as good.I don't know if it's better but that's all I can afford at this time with the economy the way it is. The reason I did not give this set 5 stars is the VESA 200X400 information which they could have put on the box to make life easier.I had to wait an extra week to mount the tv.

Reviews.Title: Good Value...
Reviews.Author: D. Castillo "fooly"
Reviews.Content: I just got this T.V. around late last year and I have had nothing really bad to say about it. The feature of this TV is great it is HD ready and HDMI ready too. I've hooked up my Xbox 360 to the HDMI port and just wow the game look so clear and even when I watch movies they are just great. The good thing about it is that I still have 1 more port for HDMI so I can still hook up something there if I needed so. There is a port for your computer if you do ever wanted to use the TV as your own monitor. I have tried and it look really nice, but then it didn't made any sense for me to use this feature at all just because I still had my computer monitor, but for the people who still have those bulky comps then this is a good alternative.Overall this product is a good buy and just good quality hey it is a Toshiba we are talking about here they make good TVs.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 32" HDTV
Reviews.Author: linda s hinkley
Reviews.Content: A 5-star product.  Arrived in excellent condition.  Picture and sound are fantastic.  Highly recommend, especially to seniors.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: D. Stockey
Reviews.Content: After checking all the stores in my area for flat panel televisions during the holiday season with all the great sales, I was still able to beat all their prices by $50 on Amazon which was an added bonus.  We had previously had a Toshiba so we knew it was going to have a sharp picture and it really does.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV with one very intermittent issue
Reviews.Author: Doctor Who "I am sflesch"
Reviews.Content: As a CompUSA employee, I got a GREAT deal on a Norwood Micro TV with an extended warranty. The coaxial tuner failed (everything else still works) and the Toshiba 32AV502U was the unit Assurant sent me as a replacement.When  I turned it on for the first time, I saw right away why people were willing to pay twice what I paid for my Norwood Micro TV. Only then did I see the wear my old TV had taken. The contrast between the blacks and whites was amazing compared to the cheap TV I first bought. The sound quality was great for built-in sound and even though the TVs had similar specs, the Toshiba blew away the Norwood Micro. I watch TV through my XBOX and the color is amazing. I switch it to my computer and I can see in such detail! HDTV through my cable box is sooooo crisp!The only issue I run into every once in a great while is it occasionally "crashes" while in use. All of a sudden, I just get loud static and whatever I'm watching is gone. It seems I have to hold the power button to turn it off. Once I turn it on, it's fine again for a long time. The problem is it didn't happen often for me to call Toshiba while under warranty. Now that it's no longer under warranty, I'm keeping my fingers crossed.

Reviews.Title: A good TV
Reviews.Author: Who Cares ?
Reviews.Content: I got it just before Xmas at best buy for $449.Now, 8 months later, of course, you can get either a bigger screen or whatever for the same price.Im fairly pleased. Takes awhile to get used to the "slow" turning on and changing of chanels.What got me interested in Toshiba was i went in walmart and of all their TVs this toshiba had the best picture.Now, 8 months later, I might opt for a 37 or 42 inch because prices have come down some.Being the tightwad i am, I will use his for at least 4 more years before upgrading. (Assuming no problems)

Reviews.Title: We LOVE this TOSHIBA TV.
Reviews.Author: DivaGal
Reviews.Content: I have had this since 3/08/09 & we watch it alot. It is on about 12 hours a day. (we work from home & we keep it on all the time, whether we are watching it or not) It is GREAT..we have no complaints. The picture quality & color is A+++. The sound is fine. It does take a few seconds for the picture to come on while changing channels, but so what, whats 2 or 3 seconds. It's great in regular LCD digital channels, but when I switch it to HDTV..OMG..the picture is superb. One feature we love is when you MUTE it..it "half mutes" on the first click, meaning it goes alot lower in volume yet not totally muted, Than when I click again, it's totally muted. I recommend this Toshiba 32" TV to everyone who wants a great TV at a great price. We also have 2 more TV's..a superb SCEPTRE & a superb Sharp 32" LCD HDTV, yet the Toshiba has us hooked. It is a bit better than our Sceptre & Sharp. I will buy another one soon.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: R. Larkin ""Shopper Junkie""
Reviews.Content: The picture is even better than I expected, and it is slim and light and was easy to mount to the wall in the bedroom, now we are not straining our necks to see the tv!  Feels like your at the movies in your own room! Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great LCD TV
Reviews.Author: J. Haggerty
Reviews.Content: I bought this LCD TV for Christmas...I have been very happy with everything about this product.  Great video.  Audio is good but not great. At this price it is a great bargain. I would buy this TV again

Reviews.Title: Good entry level HD television
Reviews.Author: L. Bullock
Reviews.Content: I have had this product for about 2 weeks now and am very pleased with it, and I don't even have an "upscaled" or "upconverted" DVD player (yet) and am basically watching 480ip (or whatever they call it). The difference between LCD and CRT is truly amazing. I got it at a really good price and even if deflation drops HDTV prices through the floor (at which point I will cry), I'll feel proud that I helped the sagging American economy as much as I could. Seriously, if you're on the fence, go ahead an get it. It's a well built, solid, crisp, sharp little machine and you'll love it. Like another reviewer said, though, if within a month or so it's sputtering and tweaking on me, I'll revise this so fast it will make yer head spin.UPDATE: As of 5/18/09 still working fine. I'm very pleased with the set. But, keep it dusted!UPDATE 2: 7/20/09 Have bought a Sony upscaling DVD player. Now am watching the TV at 1080i. Yes, there is a difference. It's not knock your socks off different, but I do notice it.UPDATE 3: 4/5/10 Still going strong. I have to make an amendment to the previous update to correct misinformation. The TV does NOT play at 1080i (even though the screen display says so). Apparently it's only recognizing that the PLAYER is 1080i. It is playing at 720. What I've research about these LCD tv's is that while they are not as long lasting as the old CRTs that would go for twenty years or more, they are improving at such fast clips these days that you'll probably be buying an improvement before the thing goes blooey anyway. Me, I'm already wanting a 47 inch. Or higher. How quickly we get spoiled.UPDATE: 2/11/11 Twice this TV has "glitched" on me by "solarizing" the picture. Meaning, the colors begin to burn in the highlights and the overall cast of it turns green. It's easily fixed by turning it off and on again, but I'm keeping my eye on this. Just a note to the wise.UPDATE: 1/2/13 Still working. No major problems. Fingers crossed.

Reviews.Title: One Issue
Reviews.Author: Lindsey Ferenz "MamaLnz"
Reviews.Content: This tv works great with one exception. Occasionally the screen will go black ans will not display the picture. We have to turn it off (which causes a loud popping sound) and then turn it back on again to solve the issue. It has not always done this, and it isn't that big of a deal, but it is an issue. The picture quality is otherwise good.

Reviews.Title: Big Brothers bigger TV
Reviews.Author: Tech_Oso
Reviews.Content: Brought this as a gift for my big older brother since he was still using a 19inch tube TV. So I got this TV and it work excellent. Great picture and plenty of imputs. I Highly suggest this as a buy.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 32AV502U 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: R. Baxter
Reviews.Content: Good TV and great price. Shipping was the best. Original manufacturer carton was placed inside the shipping box with protection assuring no shipping injuries. When looking for new electronics, always check this retailer first.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture for the money
Reviews.Author: W. Cortes "WC"
Reviews.Content: First off the item arrived in record time from the vendor. The picture compared to my Sony trinitron is more vibrant. I watched a Pay Per Movie from my cable provider and the picture was comparable to seeing it in the theater.I havent even used the HDMI cable yet. Now the quality does fade when you move to close or view from an angle. But Im sure that happens with other 780 dpi modelsA minor flaw is that the jacks are not flat against the back of the TV. The back has a lip and the jacks are on the bottom which makes it difficult to view when you want to plug your jacks in.The TV many many other features similar to a cable box for fav channels and so forth which I havent used.Im very pleased with the purchase. I did see an RCA 37" for the same price about a week after purchasing this one and wondered about that deal.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba
Reviews.Author: D. L. Duncan "trailrider48"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. The picture is clear and it was easy to set up. I looked at Sharp and Sony also before I bought this one. Anyone looking for a great HDTV should put this on their list to consider.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Ginavan Jr.
Reviews.Content: TV works as well as would be expected. Delivery service was quick and helpful.I would recommend this TV to others.

Reviews.Title: product & delivery satisfaction
Reviews.Author: Smart Shopper in NJ "Smart Shopper"
Reviews.Content: pricing, product & delivery information on the Toshiba flat screen TV were excellent!!! Thank you Amazon & One Call for outstanding service!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Donald G. Depalma "dd1969"
Reviews.Content: No issues so far, but I've only had it for a couple of weeks.Great TV for the price.Toshiba makes a great product.The picture quality without HD is not all that great, but that is typical of any of these flat screens without HD signal.So far I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: No Complaints
Reviews.Author: Ronald Stevenson "Mr. STEEL"
Reviews.Content: I bought this HDTV for a friend of mine for Christmas last year and no complaints! It's her first 32" set and she and her kids enjoy it immensely.

Reviews.Title: Great cheap TV
Reviews.Author: Andrew J. Gacek "Drew"
Reviews.Content: Works as good or better than its more expensive counterparts.  I am very happy.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Shekeshia D. Askew ""Executive shopper""
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv in November for my daughter for a Christmas present so my review will be limited since it wasnt opened until 12/25/2008. So far the TV is working great with no issues. My daughter absolutely loves it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Cynthia S. Carter "paint lady"
Reviews.Content: This tv was shipped to me ever so fast.  It took about 3 days to receive it.  The tv is great.  It's easy to set up.  The picture is so clear.  I've had absolustely no problems with it so far.  I have only had it 3 weeks.  I would definitely buy another Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Good Deal for sure !
Reviews.Author: John Metaxas "John from Madison CT"
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV.  For $449 it's well worth the money.  The picture is very good.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money.
Reviews.Author: Lori Mcnamara "Mac attack"
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the money. It arrived quickly and safely and our children are enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: tlc
Reviews.Author: Robert S. Cagle
Reviews.Content: Seems to be working well have had no problem with any of our toshiba products

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money and so far, great TV
Reviews.Author: E.M.L.
Reviews.Content: Toshiba 32AV502U 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTVI just bought this TV yesterday from Best Buy, and normally I don't buy anything from those type stores or on an impulse without a lot of research first but the price was just too good to pass up. On top of it selling for 479, we got 10% off for taking an open box one that was just returned that day. It is in brand new condition and still has the warranty from toshiba for 1 year.So far, so good. It's my first hdtv so it looks amazing to me even if it's not the top of the line. We hooked up our PCs (both mac and windows) already and played movies from them, which worked perfectly.Everything about this TV seems easy and user friendly so far. At a couple of hundred less than the Samsung and Sony 32 inch models, I cannot complain!

Reviews.Title: wow! amazing picture, easy interface
Reviews.Author: E. K. Arnold "amazon hunter"
Reviews.Content: simply an awesome tv, especially at this price. the picture is outstanding, especially with hdmi/digital fiber optic cables attached. but the thing that makes it super is the easy-to-operate user interface and easy connectivity. set up is simple and takes five minutes. menus aren't terribly complicated, and did i mention the great picture from HD TV and DVD? originally got the 26" model, then upgraded for just a few pennies more. slightly bigger form factor with the 32" but the profile is still slim.

Reviews.Title: satisfied customer
Reviews.Content: THE TV WAS GREAT. IT HAD MORE FEATURES THAN I EXPECTED. I STILL HAVE NOT SET THEM ALL UP. EVEN THOUGH BLACK FRIDAY ALL TV'S WENT ON SALE. I WANT COMPLAIN ABOUT MY PURCHASE.

Reviews.Title: Its like whoa....
Reviews.Author: T. Prentice "TP"
Reviews.Content: This is awsome for anyone who is looking for an HDTV. Toshiba technology in it is amazing and you dont have to be tech savy to know just by looking at it you'll know. this TV has amazing color and great variety of modes for anyone, whether your into gaming,sports,anime and movies this TV will give you a great experience. The price of the TV is astonishing for the quality you get. Gaming on this Tv is amazing. Sports games come to Life with amazing colour and response. Anime on this tv is the best I've seen for a TV this size and price. SDTV is awsome but there real beauty is on Movies and Games. this TV is perfect for any gamer especially PS3 owners games like Prince of Persia, Fifa 09, Fallout 3 and Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm will take your breathe away. I Give 5stars because its a superb TV for any one looking to make a transition into HD or Digital cable and the price is mind blowing for a brand like Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 32AV502U 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: B. Wong
Reviews.Content: A pretty good TV for the price though it is cheaper at Costco by about $50. I bought at Amazon because I had a gift certificate. I had the TV wake up in a mode where the display was extremely blurry where you won't be able to read the text on screen. There was no adjustment I could make to fix that condition and in desperation I powered down the TV and waited about 20 seconds then turn it on which then fixed the problem. It has not recurred in the past week and I hope it goes away forever and not a manifestation of an early failure of the display electronics.

Reviews.Title: Terrrific Television!!
Reviews.Author: William Snow
Reviews.Content: I would reccommend this product to anyone looking to purchase an HDTV with a great picture and many possibilities. I recieved a Toshiba HD DVD player and an 42" Sony HDTV for Xmas. Also I recieved a Sony DVD recorder. The packing was faaantastic for this product and I could not have been more happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Average at best
Reviews.Author: LT
Reviews.Content: This TV was not a bad price, which is why I decided to go with it, but in retrospect, there are probably some much higher quality tv's that aren't much more expensive.

ProductInfo.Features:
720p HD LCD Panel
DynaLight Backlight
TheaterWide Picture Modes
Discrete IR Codes
Vesa Compatible
ProductInfo.Name: Toshiba 32AV502U 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV
